chart_metadata.name: plex
chart_metadata.description: Plex is a media server that allows you to stream your media to any Plex client.

capabilities.name: CHOWN
capabilities.description: Plex is able to chown files.

capabilities.name: FOWNER
capabilities.description: Plex is able to bypass permission checks for it's sub-processes.

capabilities.name: DAC_OVERRIDE
capabilities.description: Plex is able to bypass permission checks.

capabilities.name: SETGID
capabilities.description: Plex is able to set group ID for it's sub-processes.

capabilities.name: SETUID
capabilities.description: Plex is able to set user ID for it's sub-processes.

capabilities.name: KILL
capabilities.description: Plex is able to kill processes.

groups.name: User and Group Configuration
groups.description: Configure User and Group for Plex

groups.name: Advanced Pod Configuration
groups.description: Configure Advanced Pod Options for Plex

attrs.label: Claim Token
attrs.description:
The claim token for the server to obtain a real server token.
If not provided, server is will not be automatically logged in.
If server is already logged in, this parameter is ignored.
You can obtain a claim token to login your server to your plex account
by visiting https://www.plex.tv/claim.

attrs.label: Image
attrs.description: The image to use for Plex.

attrs.description: Configure additional environment variables for Plex.

attrs.description: The user id that Plex files will be owned by.

attrs.description: The group id that Plex files will be owned by.

attrs.description: The port for Plex WebUI

attrs.label: Host Network
attrs.description: Bind to the host network. It's recommended to keep this disabled.

attrs.label: Size (in Gi)
attrs.description: The size of the volume quota.

attrs.label: CPU
attrs.description: CPU limit for Plex.

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid CPU limit formats are</br>
- Plain Integer - eg. 1</br>
- Float - eg. 0.5</br>
- Milicpu - eg. 500m

attrs.label: Memory
attrs.description: Memory limit for Plex.

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid Memory limit formats are</br>
- Suffixed with E/P/T/G/M/K - eg. 1G</br>
- Suffixed with Ei/Pi/Ti/Gi/Mi/Ki - eg. 1Gi</br>
- Plain Integer in bytes - eg. 1024</br>
- Exponent - eg. 134e6

2.0.3.app_readme:
Plex

Plex is a media server that allows you to stream your media to any Plex client.
2.0.3.detailed_readme:
Plex

Plex is a media server that allows you to stream your media to any Plex client.

capabilities.name: CHOWN
capabilities.description: Plex is able to chown files.

capabilities.name: FOWNER
capabilities.description: Plex is able to bypass permission checks for it's sub-processes.

capabilities.name: SYS_CHROOT
capabilities.description: Plex is able to use chroot.

capabilities.name: MKNOD
capabilities.description: Plex is able to create device nodes.

capabilities.name: DAC_OVERRIDE
capabilities.description: Plex is able to bypass permission checks.

capabilities.name: FSETID
capabilities.description: Plex is able to set file capabilities.

capabilities.name: KILL
capabilities.description: Plex is able to kill processes.

capabilities.name: SETGID
capabilities.description: Plex is able to set group ID for it's sub-processes.

capabilities.name: SETUID
capabilities.description: Plex is able to set user ID for it's sub-processes.

capabilities.name: SETPCAP
capabilities.description: Plex is able to set process capabilities.

capabilities.name: NET_BIND_SERVICE
capabilities.description: Plex is able to bind to privileged ports.

capabilities.name: SETFCAP
capabilities.description: Plex is able to set file capabilities.

capabilities.name: NET_RAW
capabilities.description: Plex is able to use raw sockets.

capabilities.name: AUDIT_WRITE
capabilities.description: Plex is able to write to audit log.

questions.label: Plex Claim Token
questions.description: The claim token for the server to obtain a real server token. If not provided, server is will not be automatically logged in. If server is already logged in, this parameter is ignored. You can obtain a claim token to login your server to your plex account by visiting https://www.plex.tv/claim.

enum.description: Create new pods and then kill old ones
Kill existing pods before creating new ones

questions.label: CPU Limit
questions.description: CPU resource limit allow  plain integer values with suffix m(milli) e.g 1000m, 100.

questions.label: Memory Limit
questions.description: Memory limits is specified by number of bytes. Followed by quantity suffix like E,P,T,G,M,k and Ei,Pi,Ti,Mi,Gi,Ki can also be used. e.g 129e6, 129M,  128974848000m, 123Mi

1.7.60.app_readme:
Plex

Plex chart is a chart designed to deploy plex in a TrueNAS SCALE kubernetes cluster.
1.7.60.detailed_readme:
Plex Media Server helm chart

Configuration

Please refer to questions.yaml for a detailed overview on supported configurable items.
